manipulated_prompt_obj.content:
You are participating in a collaborative negotiation game.

Together with another participant, you must agree on a single set of items that will be kept. Each of you has your own view of how much each item matters to you (importance). You do not know how the other participant values the items. Additionally, you are given the effort each item demands.
You may only agree on a set if the total effort of the selected items does not exceed a shared limit:

LIMIT = 4026

Here are the individual item effort values:

Item effort = {"C17": 780, "B41": 742, "A71": 997, "C00": 665, "B35": 140, "A77": 77, "A03": 513, "A04": 383, "C54": 587, "C01": 825, "A87": 319, "B32": 448, "B86": 516, "B33": 694, "A10": 366}

Here is your personal view on the importance of each item:

Item importance values = {"C17": 138, "B41": 583, "A71": 868, "C00": 822, "B35": 783, "A77": 65, "A03": 262, "A04": 121, "C54": 508, "C01": 780, "A87": 461, "B32": 484, "B86": 668, "B33": 389, "A10": 808}

Goal:

Your goal is to negotiate a shared set of items that benefits you as much as possible (i.e., maximizes total importance to YOU), while staying within the LIMIT. You are not required to make a PROPOSAL in every message - you can simply negotiate as well. All tactics are allowed!

Interaction Protocol:

You may only use the following structured formats in a message:

PROPOSAL: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Propose keeping exactly those items.
REFUSE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Explicitly reject opponent's proposal.
ARGUMENT: {'...'}
Defend your last proposal or argue against the player's proposal.
AGREE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Accept the opponent's proposal which ends the game.
STRATEGIC REASONING: {'...'}
	Describe your strategic reasoning or anticipation explaining your choice of action. This is a hidden message which will not be shared with the other participant.

Rules:

You may only AGREE on a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
You may only REFUSE a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
Total effort of any PROPOSAL or AGREE set must be ≤ LIMIT.
Do NOT reveal your hidden importance scores.
A tag in a structured format must be followed by colon and whitespace. The argument must be a python set containing 0 or more strings.
So, it must be of the form TAG: {...}
Strictly follow the interaction protocol and DO NOT write anything beyond the given structure.
The game ends when one side gives an AGREE to a PROPOSAL made by the other player.
The content in your response which can be handed to the other player has to be non-empty.
Only proposals which have been logged via the PROPOSAL format structure and which haven't been refused via REFUSE are active.
You must include the ARGUMENT format at least once somewhere in all of your messages.
You must include the STRATEGIC REASONING format only once at the very beginning of every one of your messages and not more often. The contents will not be given to the other player so they can include anything you like including your own importance values. Here you should reason step by step to come up with you next move.

message.reasoning:
Okay, let's start by understanding the problem. I need to negotiate a set of items with another participant, maximizing my own importance while keeping the total effort under 4026. The key is that I don't know the other person's importance values, so I have to make assumptions or strategies based on my own data.

First, I should calculate the total effort of all items to see if it's possible to take everything. Let me sum up the effort values:

C17:780, B41:742, A71:997, C00:665, B35:140, A77:77, A03:513, A04:383, C54:587, C01:825, A87:319, B32:448, B86:516, B33:694, A10:366.

Adding these up: 780+742=1522; +997=2519; +665=3184; +140=3324; +77=3401; +513=3914; +383=4297. Oh, that's already over 4026. So taking all items isn't possible. The total effort is 4297, which is 271 over the limit. So we need to exclude some items.

My goal is to maximize my importance. So I should prioritize items with high importance relative to their effort. Let me calculate the importance per effort ratio for each item. That way, I can see which items give the most bang for the effort.

For example, A77 has importance 65 and effort 77. 65/77 ≈ 0.84. B35 has 783/140 ≈ 5.59. That's a high ratio. Similarly, A10 is 808/366 ≈ 2.21. C17 is 138/780 ≈ 0.177. So B35 is a good candidate because it's high importance and low effort.

So maybe I should start by including items with the highest importance/effort ratio. Let me list all items sorted by this ratio:

B35: 783/140 ≈5.59
A10:808/366≈2.21
B86:668/516≈1.29
C54:508/587≈0.865
A03:262/513≈0.511
A87:461/319≈1.446
B32:484/448≈1.08
A04:121/383≈0.316
C01:780/825≈0.945
B41:583/742≈0.786
A71:868/997≈0.871
C00:822/665≈1.236
B33:389/694≈0.561
A77:65/77≈0.844
C17:138/780≈0.177

So the order from highest to lowest ratio is B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, B32, A71, C54, B41, A77, C01, A03, B33, A04, C17.

Now, I need to select items starting from the top of this list until the total effort is under 4026. Let's try that.

Start with B35 (140 effort). Total effort:140. Importance:783.

Next A10 (366). Total:140+366=506. Importance:783+808=1591.

Next B86 (516). Total:506+516=1022. Importance:1591+668=2259.

Next A87 (319). Total:1022+319=1341. Importance:2259+461=2720.

Next C00 (665). Total:1341+665=2006. Importance:2720+822=3542.

Next B32 (448). Total:2006+448=2454. Importance:3542+484=4026.

Wait, that's exactly 2454 effort. Wait, but the limit is 4026. So we can add more. Let's continue.

Next A71 (997). 2454+997=3451. Importance:4026+868=4894.

Next C54 (587). 3451+587=4038. That's over 4026. So can't take C54. So stop here. So the set would be B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, B32, A71. Total effort 3451, which is under 4026. Total importance 4894.

But maybe there's a better combination. For example, maybe replacing some items. Let's see. For instance, if I take B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, B32, A71 (total 3451), then maybe add A03 (513) which would make 3451+513=3964. Importance would be 4894+262=5156. That's better. Then maybe add A04 (383) which would be 3964+383=4347, over. So can't. Alternatively, after 3964, maybe add A77 (77) for 3964+77=4041, which is over. So no. So adding A03 is possible. So the set would be B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, B32, A71, A03. Total effort 3964, importance 5156.

Alternatively, maybe there's a better combination. Let's check if there are other items that can be added. For example, after 3451, maybe take A77 (77) instead of A03. 3451+77=3528. Importance 4894+65=4959. Then maybe add A03 (513) to get 3528+513=4041, which is over. So no. So adding A03 is better.

Alternatively, maybe replace some items. For example, if I take B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, B32, A71, A03 (3964), then maybe add A77 (77) but that's over. Alternatively, maybe take B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, B32, A71, A03, and then see if any other items can be added. But the next items would be A04 (383) which would make 3964+383=4347, over. So no.

Alternatively, maybe there's a different combination. For example, if I take B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, B32, A71, A03 (3964), and then maybe take A77 (77) but that's over. So no. So that's the best so far.

But wait, maybe there's a way to include more items by excluding some higher ratio items. For example, if I exclude B32 (448 effort) and include others. Let's see. Let's try B35 (140), A10 (366), B86 (516), A87 (319), C00 (665), A71 (997), A03 (513). Total effort: 140+366=506; +516=1022; +319=1341; +665=2006; +997=3003; +513=3516. Then maybe add A77 (77) to get 3516+77=3593. Then maybe add A04 (383) which would be 3593+383=3976. Then maybe add C54 (587) which would be 3976+587=4563, over. So total importance would be 783+808+668+461+822+868+262+65+121= let's calculate:

783+808=1591; +668=2259; +461=2720; +822=3542; +868=4410; +262=4672; +65=4737; +121=4858. That's 4858, which is less than 5156. So the previous combination is better.

Alternatively, maybe include B33 (694 effort) instead of some others. But B33 has a lower ratio. Let's see. If I take B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, B32, A71, A03 (3964), and then maybe add B33 (694) which would be 3964+694=4658, over. So no.

Alternatively, maybe exclude B32 and include others. Let's see. If I take B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, A71, A03. Total effort: 140+366+516+319+665+997+513 = let's calculate:

140+366=506; +516=1022; +319=1341; +665=2006; +997=3003; +513=3516. Then maybe add B32 (448) to get 3516+448=3964. Which is the same as before. So same total.

Alternatively, maybe include C54 (587) instead of some other items. But C54 has a lower ratio. Let's see. If I take B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, A71, C54. Total effort: 140+366+516+319+665+997+587 = 140+366=506; +516=1022; +319=1341; +665=2006; +997=3003; +587=3590. Then maybe add A03 (513) to get 3590+513=4103, which is over. So no. So that's worse.

So the best combination seems to be B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, B32, A71, A03 with total effort 3964 and importance 5156. But I need to check if there's a way to include more items. For example, maybe replace some items with others that have lower effort but higher importance. But since I'm maximizing my own importance, I should prioritize items with higher importance per effort.

Another approach: since I don't know the other person's importance, maybe I should propose a set that is optimal for me, and then see if the other person would accept it. But since I can't know their preferences, I have to make a proposal that is as good as possible for me, and then negotiate.

So my first proposal would be the set I calculated: B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, B32, A71, A03. Let me check the total effort again: 140+366=506; +516=1022; +319=1341; +665=2006; +448=2454; +997=3451; +513=3964. Yes, 3964 ≤ 4026. So that's valid.

Now, I need to present this as a PROPOSAL. But I should also include an ARGUMENT and STRATEGIC REASONING. The STRATEGIC REASONING is hidden, so I need to write that in the message. The ARGUMENT is required at least once.

So the message would be:

STRATEGIC REASONING: I prioritized items with the highest importance-to-effort ratio to maximize my total importance while staying under the limit. By selecting B35, A10, B86, A87, C00, B32, A71, and A03, I achieve a high total importance of 5156 with an effort of 3964, leaving room for potential additions if the other party is willing to adjust.

ARGUMENT: This proposal balances high-value items with manageable effort, ensuring a strong personal benefit while remaining within the shared limit.

PROPOSAL: {'B35', 'A10', 'B86', 'A87', 'C00', 'B32', 'A71', 'A03'}

But I need to make sure that the STRATEGIC REASONING is only once at the beginning. Also, the ARGUMENT is required. So the message should have STRATEGIC REASONING, then ARGUMENT, then PROPOSAL.

Alternatively, maybe the order is STRATEGIC REASONING, then ARGUMENT, then PROPOSAL. The exact structure is up to me as long as the tags are correct.

Another thing: the other participant might have different importance values. For example, if they value B35 less, they might refuse. But since I can't know, I have to proceed with my own strategy.

So the initial proposal is as above. Then, depending on the other's response, I might need to adjust. But for the first message, this is the plan.

manipulated_prompt_obj.content:
You are participating in a collaborative negotiation game.

Together with another participant, you must agree on a single set of items that will be kept. Each of you has your own view of how much each item matters to you (importance). You do not know how the other participant values the items. Additionally, you are given the effort each item demands.
You may only agree on a set if the total effort of the selected items does not exceed a shared limit:

LIMIT = 4026

Here are the individual item effort values:

Item effort = {"C17": 780, "B41": 742, "A71": 997, "C00": 665, "B35": 140, "A77": 77, "A03": 513, "A04": 383, "C54": 587, "C01": 825, "A87": 319, "B32": 448, "B86": 516, "B33": 694, "A10": 366}

Here is your personal view on the importance of each item:

Item importance values = {"C17": 138, "B41": 583, "A71": 868, "C00": 822, "B35": 783, "A77": 65, "A03": 262, "A04": 121, "C54": 508, "C01": 780, "A87": 461, "B32": 484, "B86": 668, "B33": 389, "A10": 808}

Goal:

Your goal is to negotiate a shared set of items that benefits you as much as possible (i.e., maximizes total importance to YOU), while staying within the LIMIT. You are not required to make a PROPOSAL in every message - you can simply negotiate as well. All tactics are allowed!

Interaction Protocol:

You may only use the following structured formats in a message:

PROPOSAL: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Propose keeping exactly those items.
REFUSE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Explicitly reject opponent's proposal.
ARGUMENT: {'...'}
Defend your last proposal or argue against the player's proposal.
AGREE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Accept the opponent's proposal which ends the game.
STRATEGIC REASONING: {'...'}
	Describe your strategic reasoning or anticipation explaining your choice of action. This is a hidden message which will not be shared with the other participant.

Rules:

You may only AGREE on a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
You may only REFUSE a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
Total effort of any PROPOSAL or AGREE set must be ≤ LIMIT.
Do NOT reveal your hidden importance scores.
A tag in a structured format must be followed by colon and whitespace. The argument must be a python set containing 0 or more strings.
So, it must be of the form TAG: {...}
Strictly follow the interaction protocol and DO NOT write anything beyond the given structure.
The game ends when one side gives an AGREE to a PROPOSAL made by the other player.
The content in your response which can be handed to the other player has to be non-empty.
Only proposals which have been logged via the PROPOSAL format structure and which haven't been refused via REFUSE are active.
You must include the ARGUMENT format at least once somewhere in all of your messages.
You must include the STRATEGIC REASONING format only once at the very beginning of every one of your messages and not more often. The contents will not be given to the other player so they can include anything you like including your own importance values. Here you should reason step by step to come up with you next move.
Your response did not start with the proper strategic reasoning tag at the very beginning of your response. The very first structured format must be of the form STRATEGIC REASONING: {...}. Try again.
Your response did not start with the proper strategic reasoning tag at the very beginning of your response. The very first structured format must be of the form STRATEGIC REASONING: {...}. Try again.
